intro: Scandix hispida, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bristly, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, stiff hairs. Its yellow flowers are typically arranged in a single head, surrounded by pale green to brown bracts. Scandix hispida is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in sunny, dry environments.
